benchmark_details.name: MVHumanNet
benchmark_details.overview: MVHumanNet is a large-scale multi-view dataset containing 4,500 human identities, 9,000 daily outfits, and 645 million frames with extensive annotations, facilitating human-centric tasks in the domain of 3D vision.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale multi-view dataset for 3D human-centric tasks.

data.source: Captured using a synchronized multi-view human capture system with 48 cameras.
data.annotation: Includes human masks, camera parameters, 2D and 3D keypoints, SMPL/SMPLX parameters, and corresponding textual descriptions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on performance in various human-centric tasks using MVHumanNet.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better model performance in recognizing actions from multi-view data.
methodology.validation: Pilot studies demonstrated the capability to improve performance across multiple tasks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Diverse representation including age, gender, and body shape across 4,500 identities.
